butterfly.definition::
[n.] 【虫】蝴蝶；轻浮多变；轻薄浮浅的人；【泳】蝶泳
[v.] 切开摊平
[网络] 花蝴蝶；蝴蝶机；蝴蝶君
butterfly.example::
[1] I'm a monkey, (Laughter) blowing kisses at a butterfly. But I'm still suggesting you and I should meet.
[2] The Man felt distressed and decided to help the butterfly: He took a pair of scissors and cleft the cocoon carefully.
[3] As if the butterfly flies only sea, nobody has the heart to blame.

cunning.definition::
[n.] 狡猾；诡诈；狡黠
[adj.] 狡猾的；奸诈的；诡诈的；灵巧的
[网络] 狡诈的；巧妙的；可爱的
cunning.example::
[1] He had never been hunted by a bloodhound nor had he ever seen that brute's unerring instinct baffled by human cunning.
[2] Back at our desks come Tuesday, sunburned and a bit disoriented, we flash a cunning grin when a co-worker asks, "How was your weekend? "
[3] The red fox's resourcefulness has earned it a legendary reputation for intelligence and cunning.

unwilling.definition::
[adj.] 不愿意；不情愿；勉强的；无奈的
[网络] 不愿意的；不情愿的；不乐意
unwilling.example::
[1] The children were unwilling to turn off the TV and go to bed.
[2] Others are more like the captain, driven by an inner force to start a business and unwilling to take "no" for an answer.
[3] Investors appeared to be unwilling to hold big positions in stocks ahead of the weekend and any news on Ireland's crisis.

country.definition::
[n.] 国家；乡村；乡下；国民
[adj.] 祖国的；家乡的；地方的；粗鲁的
[网络] 乡村音乐；农村；地区
country.example::
[1] The British Chambers of Commerce said the figures raised fresh questions over the country's "AAA" credit rating.
[2] As the country has no manufacturing base to speak of, most items have to be imported, which pushes prices up.
[3] Analysts said the country's export-led recovery appeared to be faltering as the value of the yen appreciates.

convenience.definition::
[n.] 方便；便利；适宜；便利的事物（或设施）
[网络] 便利性；方便性；消费者方便
convenience.example::
[1] Placing the matrix near the beginning of your guide is for your reader's convenience.
[2] Ritchie's running joke was that C had "the power of assembly language and the convenience of . . . assembly language. "
[3] I believe they were all got up by a woman who didn't hesitate to sacrifice you to her own convenience.

outdoors.definition::
[n.] 野外；旷野；郊外
[adv.] 在户外；在野外
[网络] 户外活动；室外；户外运动
outdoors.example::
[1] It may not seemlogical, but the cozy indoors is often worse for your allergies thanthe raw outdoors.
[2] The children haven't been outdoors (have been indoors) all day. Let them play outdoors for a while.
[3] What do you use this machine for? how much is the daily yield? and what is the productive enviroment , indoors or outdoors?

soccer.definition::
[n.] 足球运动
[网络] 英式足球；足球比赛；足球鞋
soccer.example::
[1] He was joking, of course, but there is no denying the passion with which soccer fans all around the world follow their favorite teams.
[2] The Soccer City Stadium where the opening ceremony was set to take place in just a few days' time. . .
[3] Manager Diego Maradona, once the greatest soccer player on Earth, has been reduced to something of a cartoonish figure.

leap.definition::
[n.] 跳越；跳跃；跳高；骤变
[v.] 跳；跳跃；跳越；猛冲
[网络] 飞跃；跃过；跳动
leap.example::
[1] It was the wolf manner of fighting, to strike and leap away; but there was more to it than this.
[2] These folks had already made much progress in their evolution and are ready to take a leap forward.
[3] It was the most amazing leap I ever saw in my life, except by nutty acrobats, much like a mountain goat, which he was, it turned out.

honey.definition::
[n.] 蜂蜜；亲爱的；宝贝；蜜糖
[网络] 甜心；甜心辣舞；蜜糖第一名
honey.example::
[1] But I said to you, "You will possess their land; I will give it to you as an inheritance, a land flowing with milk and honey. "
[2] Hi honey. I'm home. I can't wait to show you these clothes. What do you think about this? It would be perfect for Tiffany's party.
[3] "A young Springfieldianite has discovered a new comet to be known as the 'Bart Simpson Comet'. " Oh, honey, I'm so proud of you.

clean.definition::
[adj.] 洁净的；干净的；爱干净的；爱整洁的
[v.] 除去…的灰尘；使…干净；打扫；变干净
[n.] 打扫；清扫
[adv.] 完全地
[网络] 清洁；清洁的；清除
clean.example::
[1] It's part of her clean-cut, Chinese girl-next-door image that seems to appeal to many in mainland China.
[2] Coding has to be clean . I will work with you to provide the best Layout structure for the design. Like to get a comment form the experts.
[3] I do not know why, what the word love with him, the smile, clean and sweet boy.

exceptional.definition::
[adj.] 杰出的；优秀的；卓越的；异常的
[网络] 例外的；特别的；特殊的
exceptional.example::
[1] The situation of the declasse intellectual was no longer exceptional; it had turned into something permanent and unpleasant to confront.
[2] But I agree with you completely that Song was exceptional for a defensive midfielder with the first goal.
[3] He Jin, one of her short black hair, above a pair of pink with other credit card issuers eyes, looks are not exceptional.

commander.definition::
[n.] 指挥官；负责人；（英国或美国）海军中校；（英国）伦敦高级警官
[网络] 司令官；指挥员；司令员
commander.example::
[1] A 17th-century French naval commander was shocked to see a Dutch captain sweeping out his own quarters.
[2] Other than Mace Windu, they followed a clone commander that had armor similar to that of a clone paratrooper.
[3] Our commander in Afghanistan, Tommy Franks, recently said the Senator's understanding of events does not square with reality.

broad.definition::
[adj.] 宽阔的；广阔的；…宽（用于表示距离的量度之后）
[adv.] 宽广地；土腔十足地
[n.] （对女人的粗俗称呼）婆娘
[网络] 远大；宽的；广泛的
broad.example::
[1] For all that, the subsidy reforms enjoy broad support, even from his stiffest critics.
[2] And it doesn't seem to me that there is grass-roots, broad support for the behavior of diplomats, say, stealing [inaudible] DNA.
[3] In a speech at the Asia Society in New York, last weekend, she said Washington has a very broad agenda when it comes to China.

immigrant.definition::
[n.] （外来）移民；外侨
[adj.] 侨民的
[网络] 从某国来的移民；移民的；移来的，移民的
immigrant.example::
[1] It has no state capital-gains or income tax, and a business-friendly and immigrant-tolerant attitude.
[2] I began my life as the son of immigrant, and I worked my way up to the presidency of the Ford Motor Company.
[3] China, which used to be closed to immigrant labour, is now handing out residency permits to professionals, academics and entrepreneurs.

productivity.definition::
[n.] 生产率；生产效率
[网络] 生产力；生产能力；多产
productivity.example::
[1] So, putting all this together, what really happened was the productivity of our staff was significantly higher than anyone else.
[2] Ever since Josiah Wedgwood invented marketing a few centuries ago, it has been used to increase productivity and wealth.
[3] Trend of corn yield approximately agreed with the productivity index, and there was a positive relationship between them.

slit.definition::
[n.] 狭长的切口；长而窄的口子；狭缝；裂缝
[v.] 在…上开狭长口子；切开；划破
[网络] 缝隙；撕裂；叉
slit.example::
[1] How much more exciting than peering through the slit of a door into a mean little hall with a hatstand and two umbrellas!
[2] The delivery of food through a low slit in the door is the only way of marking time, dividing day from night.
[3] It took off in a sudden explosion of foam, slicing across the green waters toward the dark slit of safety in the far cavern wall.

cloud.definition::
[n.] 云；云朵；阴影；一团
[v.] 使难以理解；使记不清楚；使模糊；显得阴沉（或恐惧、愤怒等）
[网络] 克劳德；云端；云状物
cloud.example::
[1] So the Sun retired behind a cloud, and the Wind began to blow as hard as it could upon the traveler.
[2] Like many management books, "Behind the Cloud" contains plenty of the sort of jargon that turns off admirers of great literature.
[3] "My heart is like the golden casket of the kiss" , said the sunset cloud to the sun.

client.definition::
[n.] 客户；当事人；委托人；（连接在服务器上的）客户机
[网络] 客户端；顾客；用户端
client.example::
[1] Discuss the purpose of each medication and its action with client. Allow client to ask any questions about drugs.
[2] Both the server and the client must be prepared to get Ajax requests and responses out of order, and some of them might even be missed.
[3] I finally got to see my client. You will recall the first trip. I made to Hongshan Prison was unsuccessful.

use.definition::
[v.] 使用；利用；运用；消耗
[n.] 使用；用途；用法；使用权
[网络] 应用；用处
use.example::
[1] Proponents of the defensive interpretation warned that Microsoft has a track record of trying to use its IE browser to hurt rivals.
[2] printing this order confirmation email for your records or to use as a receipt.
[3] The key is to begin to understand a city in terms of density, intensity and use, and its social and economic framework.

graceful.definition::
[adj.] 优美的；(某物)雅致的；大方的
[网络] 优雅的；得体的；柔美
graceful.example::
[1] While he had been abroad, his mother's letters-graceful, witty, informative, cheerful-had been his main link with home.
[2] She has graceful stature, fair face and atramentous eyes, and the smile in her cheek generates so much charming.
[3] Variety comb innovative process design, pure hand-made, fashionable, graceful, exquisite workmanship, easy to use, easy to carry.
